Title: Sergeant York
Cast: Gary Cooper, Walter Brennan, Joan Leslie, George Tobias, Stanley Ridges, Margaret Wycherly, Ward Bond, Noah Beery Jr., June Lockhart, Dickie Moore, Clem Bevans, Howard Da Silva, Charles Trowbridge, Harvey Stephens, David Bruce
Plot: A hillbilly sharpshooter drafted in WW1 despite his claim to be a pacifist, who ends up becoming a war hero. A hillbilly sharpshooter becomes one of the most celebrated American heroes of WWI when he single-handedly attacks and captures a German position using the same strategy as in turkey shoot. Written by Keith Loh <loh@sfu.ca>
Keywords: hillbilly, war hero, conscientious objector, war propaganda, doughboy
Location: Burro Flats, Simi Hills, California, USA
Actors: Gary Cooper, Walter Brennan, Joan Leslie
Writer: Abem Finkel (original screen play), Harry Chandlee (original screen play) | 4 more credits »
Description: Directed by Howard Hawks.  With Gary Cooper, Walter Brennan, Joan Leslie, George Tobias. A hillbilly sharpshooter drafted in WW1 despite his claim to be a pacifist, who ends up becoming a war hero.
